item.title: PDF-Tools
item.author: mail@eucalypto.de (Viktor Papara)
item.description: PDFs are a fine thing. But sometimes we want to edit them. Mostly for printing. Pdfjam This command-line tool named pdfjam uses latex to edit PDFs. It should be available in the repositories of most Linux distros. There are also useful examples. You can offset pages of a (twosided) document in order to make room for a binding, etc.: pdfjam --twoside myfile.pdf --offset '1cm 0cm' --suffix 'offset' This doesn’t scale, it just shifts the content.
